items.title: Charlie Kirk: Conservative influencer Charlie Kirk shot dead at Utah event
items.standfirst: US far-right activist and influencer Charlie Kirk, an influential ally of President Donald Trump, was fatally shot in the neck on Wednesday at an event at a Utah university. Videos posted to social media showed Kirk, 31, speaking into a microphone at the university's Sorensen Center courtyard as a single shot rang out and stunned spectators ran for cover.
items.content: US far-right activist and influencer Charlie Kirk, an influential ally of President Donald Trump, was fatally shot in the neck on Wednesday at an event at a Utah university. Videos posted to social media showed Kirk, 31, speaking into a microphone at the university's Sorensen Center courtyard as a single shot rang out and stunned spectators ran for cover.

items.title: New NASA findings hint at ancient life on Mars
items.standfirst: NASA’s Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life, scientists reported Wednesday. They stressed that in-depth analysis is needed of the sample gathered there by Perseverance – ideally in labs on Earth – before reaching any conclusions.
items.content: NASA’s Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life, scientists reported Wednesday. They stressed that in-depth analysis is needed of the sample gathered there by Perseverance – ideally in labs on Earth – before reaching any conclusions.

clusters.title: Peter Mandelson sacked for saying Epstein’s first conviction was wrong, minister says – UK politics live
clusters.neutral_headline: Peter Mandelson Sacked as UK Ambassador Over Epstein Ties

items.title: Peter Mandelson sacked for saying Epstein’s first conviction was wrong, minister says – UK politics live
items.standfirst: Foreign Office minister says ex-ambassador’s comment that Epstein’s conviction was wrongful ‘is new information’Stephen Doughty, a Foreign Office minister, is responding to the UQ about Peter Mandelson.He starts by making the point that it is the anniversary of the “despicable” 9/11 terrorism attacks.Keir Starmer must sack Peter Mandelson without further delay - and come clean about what he knew when, and whether he sanctioned blocking the publication of damaging material. UK government documents shouldn’t be hidden from the public just because they are damaging to the Labour party - and by backing Peter Mandelson to the hilt, the prime minister’s own reputation is now on the line. Continue reading...
items.content: Foreign Office minister says ex-ambassador’s comment that Epstein’s conviction was wrongful ‘is new information’Stephen Doughty, a Foreign Office minister, is responding to the UQ about Peter Mandelson.He starts by making the point that it is the anniversary of the “despicable” 9/11 terrorism attacks.Keir Starmer must sack Peter Mandelson without further delay - and come clean about what he knew when, and whether he sanctioned blocking the publication of damaging material. UK government documents shouldn’t be hidden from the public just because they are damaging to the Labour party - and by backing Peter Mandelson to the hilt, the prime minister’s own reputation is now on the line. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Poland, Lithuania, Ukraine slam Russian drone attack
clusters.neutral_headline: Poland, Ukraine Condemn Russian Drone Incursion

items.title: Poland, Lithuania, Ukraine slam Russian drone attack
items.standfirst: The foreign ministers of Lithuania, Poland and Ukraine on Thursday condemned the recent incursion of Russian drones into Polish territory, calling it a deliberate provocation and escalation of tension...
items.content: The foreign ministers of Lithuania, Poland and Ukraine on Thursday condemned the recent incursion of Russian drones into Polish territory, calling it a deliberate provocation and escalation of tension...

items.title: NATO forces shoot down Russian drones over Poland
items.standfirst: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Poland dismisses Russia’s claim drone incursion was unintentional as Ukraine calls for joint European air defence system – as it happened

For the latest updates on this story, read our full report:Poland ‘closer to military conflict than at any time since WW2’ as Nato allies weigh response to drone incursionLubelskie region governor Krzysztof Komorski is leading an emergency meeting with the police this morning. In a post on X, he urged residents to follow the guidance from the relevant authorities.Prime minister Donald Tusk meanwhile said in his latest update that he is in “constant contact” with Nato secretary general Mark Rutte. items.title: Poland ‘closer to military conflict than at any time since WW2’ as Nato allies weigh response to Russian drones
items.standfirst: Donald Tusk says Poland dealing with a large-scale provocation after at least 19 violations of Polish airspacePoland’s prime minister, Donald Tusk, said the country is closer to military conflict “than at any time since the second world war” as Warsaw and Nato allies weighed a response to an incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace.Poland scrambled its own and Nato air defences, shooting down at least three drones, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory early on Wednesday in the most significant way since the full-scale invasion more than three years ago. Continue reading...

items.content: The UK is looking to bolster Poland's air defences after suspected Russian drones were shot down in its airspace.

items.title: Here’s What to Know About Poland Shooting Down Russian Drones
items.standfirst: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.
items.content: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.

items.title: Poland shoots down 'huge number' of Russian drones
items.standfirst: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.
items.content: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

ai_summary: Poland, Lithuania, and Ukraine condemned the Russian drone incursion into Poland.
Poland said it was closer to military conflict than since World War II.
NATO forces shot down at least three Russian drones over Poland.
Poland's Prime Minister Donald Tusk is in contact with NATO Secretary General.
The UN Security Council will hold an emergency meeting on the incident.

clusters.title: Oracle co-founder Ellison briefly overtakes Musk as world's richest man
clusters.neutral_headline: Larry Ellison Briefly Overtakes Elon Musk as Richest Man

items.title: Oracle co-founder Ellison briefly overtakes Musk as world's richest man
items.standfirst: Larry Ellison, the 81-year-old co-founder of US business software company Oracle, briefly became the world's richest man on Wednesday after shares in Oracle surged over 40 percent. The company is predicting that its cloud infrastructure business will grow from $10 billion to $144 billion by 2030, thanks to AI-driven demand for its services. Also in this edition: Cuba suffers another island-wide blackout – the fifth in the past year.
items.content: Larry Ellison, the 81-year-old co-founder of US business software company Oracle, briefly became the world's richest man on Wednesday after shares in Oracle surged over 40 percent. The company is predicting that its cloud infrastructure business will grow from $10 billion to $144 billion by 2030, thanks to AI-driven demand for its services. Also in this edition: Cuba suffers another island-wide blackout – the fifth in the past year.

items.title: Firms will hesitate to invest in US after raid - S Korea president
items.standfirst: More than 300 South Koreans who were arrested in the raid are due to return home on Friday.
items.content: More than 300 South Koreans who were arrested in the raid are due to return home on Friday.

items.title: S. Koreans detained in US raid set to return, Seoul warns of chilling effect on investments
items.standfirst: The process of releasing hundreds of South Korean workers detained in a US immigration crackdown on a Georgia Hyundai plant was under way, officials in Seoul said Thursday. South Korean President Lee Jae-myung called the raid "bewildering" and noted it could have a chilling effect on future investment.

items.title: Big pharma will stop investing in UK, warns eminent scientist Sir John Bell
items.standfirst: Warning follows news of US drugmaker Merck’s decision to scrap planned £1bn London research centreSir John Bell, a prominent scientist who brought business and government together during the Covid-19 vaccine rollout, has warned that other big pharmaceutical companies will stop investing in the UK, after Merck’s decision to scrap its planned £1bn London research centre.Bell, a former regius professor of medicine at the University of Oxford, told the BBC’s Today programme that he had spoken to several chief executives of large companies in the past six months “and they’re all in the same space, and that is, they’re not going to do any more investing in the UK”. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Brazil Supreme Court justice votes to annul Bolsonaro case, breaking with two peers
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil Supreme Court Justice Votes to Annul Bolsonaro Case

items.title: Brazil Supreme Court justice votes to annul Bolsonaro case, breaking with two peers
items.standfirst: A Brazilian judge voted on Wednesday to acquit former president Jair Bolsonaro of an alleged coup attempt and annul his trial over jurisdiction. Justice Luiz Fux disagreed with his two peers on the five-justice panel, shifting all eyes on the last two judges as the high-stakes trial continues.
items.content: A Brazilian judge voted on Wednesday to acquit former president Jair Bolsonaro of an alleged coup attempt and annul his trial over jurisdiction. items.title: First two Brazilian judges vote to convict Jair Bolsonaro in coup plot trial
items.standfirst: Three more supreme court justices to cast their votes in coming days, with verdict expected by Thursday‘He’s always on the attack’: the Brazilian judge prosecuting Bolsonaro inspires both love and hateJair Bolsonaro led a criminal organisation that sought to plunge Brazil back into dictatorship with a murderous power grab involving special forces assassins and a vast disinformation campaign, the supreme court judge presiding over the former president’s trial has claimed as he voted for Bolsonaro’s conviction.Alexandre de Moraes was the first supreme court justice of five to announce his decision on Tuesday, as the trial of Bolsonaro and seven alleged co-conspirators – including four senior members of the military and the former head of Brazil’s answer to MI6 – entered its final stretch. Continue reading...

Continue reading...
